CVE-2024-21887
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.32%

updated 2024-01-22T18:31:16

6 posts

A command injection vulnerability in web components of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows an authenticated administrator to send specially crafted requests and execute arbitrary commands on the appliance.

Nuclei template

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T16:52:20.525Z ##

I buried the lede in not mentioning that UNC5291 is assessed with medium confidence to be associated with Volt Typhoon, a Chinese state-sponsored Advanced Persistent Threat (APT).  See related The Record reporting: Volt Typhoon and 4 other groups targeting US energy and defense sectors through Ivanti bugs

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #cyberespionage #China #activeexploitation #eitw #zeroday #KEV #CISA #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2024_21893 #UNC5221 #UNC5266 #UNC5330 #UNC5337 #UNC5291

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:53:52.007Z ##

Mandiant releases part 4 of the Ivanti Connect Secure incident response investigation. They detail different types of post-exploitation activity across their IR engagements. Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893. New TTPs, new malware families and new IOC: ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-post-exploitation-lateral-movement

EDIT: For your situational awareness, it's my understanding that future Mandiant articles will be located at https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #cyberespionage #China #activeexploitation #eitw #zeroday #KEV #CISA #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2024_21893 #UNC5221 #UNC5266 #UNC5330 #UNC5337 #UNC5291

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-04T16:52:20.000Z ##

I buried the lede in not mentioning that UNC5291 is assessed with medium confidence to be associated with Volt Typhoon, a Chinese state-sponsored Advanced Persistent Threat (APT).  See related The Record reporting: Volt Typhoon and 4 other groups targeting US energy and defense sectors through Ivanti bugs

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-04T14:53:52.000Z ##

Mandiant releases part 4 of the Ivanti Connect Secure incident response investigation. They detail different types of post-exploitation activity across their IR engagements. Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893. New TTPs, new malware families and new IOC: ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-post-exploitation-lateral-movement

EDIT: For your situational awareness, it's my understanding that future Mandiant articles will be located at https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/

##

CVE-2024-27198
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.21%

updated 2024-03-21T05:01:12

1 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.11.4 authentication bypass allowing to perform admin actions was possible

Nuclei template

8 repos

https://github.com/rampantspark/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/CharonDefalt/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/Shimon03/Explora-o-RCE-n-o-autenticado-JetBrains-TeamCity-CVE-2024-27198-

https://github.com/yoryio/CVE-2024-27198

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2024-27198-EXPLOIT

https://github.com/passwa11/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-27198-RCE

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-27198

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T17:03:50.000Z ##

PATCH TEAMCITY NOW! Why you should care about updating your TeamCity:

  • JetBrains wonât reveal any details about the 26 vulnerabilities fixed in version 2024.03 released today. Check the release notes. These could be exploited zero-days and we wouldnât know.
  • On 18 October 2023 Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also attributed to RGB) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.
  • On 13 December 2023, CISA put out a cybersecurity advisory "Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) Exploiting JetBrains TeamCity CVE Globally" for the exploitation of CVE-2023-42793. For that TeamCity vulnerability, time from public disclosure (19 September 2023) to proof of concept (Rapid7âs universally accepted PoC on 25 September) was 6 days. Within 7 days of that, Rapid7 notes active exploitation. CISA added it to the KEV Catalog on 4 October, thatâs 15 days. Microsoftâs article was 18 October, which was nation state abuse within 12-22 days.
  • Confirmed exploitation of CVE-2024-27198 (9.8, disclosed on 04 March 2024 by JetBrains, has Proof of Concept, in KEV Catalog 07 March 2024) was observed by @da_667 of Proofpoint's Emerging Threats team on 06 March 2024.
  • Exploitation of CVE-2024-27198 has been observed and reported by Trend Micro on 19 March 2024 to drop Jasmin ransomware, XMRig cryptocurrency miner, SparkRAT backdoor, and Cobalt Strike beacons.
  • On 08 March 2024, Guidepoint Security stated that BianLian threat actors, previously known for their ransomware, leveraged CVE-2024-27198 for initial access to perform credential dumping and using a Powershell version of their backdoor.

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:53:52.007Z ##

Mandiant releases part 4 of the Ivanti Connect Secure incident response investigation. They detail different types of post-exploitation activity across their IR engagements. Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893. New TTPs, new malware families and new IOC: ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-post-exploitation-lateral-movement

- CVE-2023-40051 CVSS 9.9 in Progress OpenEdge
- CVE-2024-2389 CVSS 10.0 in Progress Flowmon
- CVE-2024-1800 CVSS 9.9 in Progress Telerik
- CVE-2023-42657 CVSS 9.9 in Progress WS_FTP
- CVE-2023-29375 CVSS 9.8 in Progress Sitefinity
- CVE-2023-2023 CVSS 9.8 in Progress DataDirect Connect for ODBC
- CVE-2023-35708 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit
- and the infamous CVE-2023-34362 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit.

There are other criticals too, but I figured 9.8 was a good cutoff to make the point that they belong in the same BINGO card as Ivanti, Fortinet, Cisco, and Exchange.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T11:23:46.000Z ##

Security Week did their homework and reported that CVE-2023-24955 was part of a 2-bug exploit chain showcased at last year's Pwn2Own Vancouver in March 2023. The exploit chain would allow for unauthenticated remote code execution on SharePoint servers with elevated privileges. Star Labs team who demonstrated them, released the vulnerability details and proofs of concepts for CVE-2023-29357 and CVE-2023-24955 in September and December 2023. CVE-2023-29357 was added to the KEV Catalog on 10 January 2024. ð https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-second-sharepoint-flaw-disclosed-at-pwn2own-exploited-in-attacks/

rye at 2024-04-03T02:49:14.448Z ##

First, you'll don the armor of WinRAR, not to defend against the xz backdoors, but to shield yourself from the icy chill of CVE-2023-38831, a vulnerability that lurks in the shadows, waiting to exploit the trusting user.

Next, you'll don the cloak of PKZip, a tool as ancient as time itself, but with a purpose as sharp as a dagger. It's not just for show; it's your shield against the CVE-2023-38831, a vulnerability that, despite its age, still poses a threat to the unsuspecting.

Then, you'll don the helmet of gzip, a warrior of the digital realm, ready to face the zip-slip, a sneaky little bug that lurks within PKZip's archives, waiting to strike. With gzip, you'll stand your ground, ready to defend against this sneaky attack.

Finally, you'll don the boots of 7zip, a guardian of the digital fortress, your last line of defense against the ever-evolving threats of the digital world, including the notorious CVE-2022-1271, a vulnerability that has been whispered about in the darkest corners of the internet.

So, my dear, prepare yourself for a journey of endless clicking, a testament to your resolve and your commitment to digital security. Just keep clicking, and perhaps, one day, you'll find the document you seek, unscathed and ready to be opened.

CVE-2023-24955
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 34.44%

updated 2023-11-07T05:06:50

1 posts

Microsoft SharePoint Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

3 repos

https://github.com/former-farmer/CVE-2023-24955-PoC

https://github.com/AndreOve/CVE-2023-24955-real-RCE

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2023-29357

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T11:23:46.000Z ##

Security Week did their homework and reported that CVE-2023-24955 was part of a 2-bug exploit chain showcased at last year's Pwn2Own Vancouver in March 2023. The exploit chain would allow for unauthenticated remote code execution on SharePoint servers with elevated privileges. Star Labs team who demonstrated them, released the vulnerability details and proofs of concepts for CVE-2023-29357 and CVE-2023-24955 in September and December 2023. CVE-2023-29357 was added to the KEV Catalog on 10 January 2024. ð https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-second-sharepoint-flaw-disclosed-at-pwn2own-exploited-in-attacks/

Anyscale, officially: "Ray does not have authentication built in - is a long-standing design decision based on how Rayâs security boundaries are drawn and consistent with Ray deployment best practices" https://www.anyscale.com/blog/update-on-ray-cves-cve-2023-6019-cve-2023-6020-cve-2023-6021-cve-2023-48022-cve-2023-48023

##

CVE-2019-5010
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.85%

updated 2024-04-04T02:38:18

1 posts

An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the X509 certificate parser of Python.org Python 2.7.11 / 3.6.6. A specially crafted X509 certificate can cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using crafted certificates to trigger this vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/JonathanWilbur/CVE-2019-5010

rotan@mastodon.ie at 2024-04-02T23:14:06.000Z ##

@terri

Funny! Though just because Python is relatively safe from that kind of trip hazard, the runtime might not be, as lessons from CVE-2019-5010 demonstrate.

Good luck weeding out the AI nonsense.

CVE-2024-20767
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.53%

updated 2024-03-18T12:31:54

1 posts

ColdFusion versions 2023.6, 2021.12 and earlier are affected by an Improper Access Control vulnerability that could lead to arbitrary file system read. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass security measures and gain unauthorized access to sensitive files and perform arbitrary file system write. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

##
keefer@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T18:13:23.000Z ##

Can anyone help me figure out some discrepancies I'm seeing with #cvss and #nvd data?

I'm doing some research on CVEs for prioritization and weaponization.

CVE-2008-3844 is one of the vulns that stands out due to a high CVSS base score (9.3) + high #EPSS score (.86 percentile).

One of the references in NVD was for an IBM XForce page (link in comment) which shows the CVSS base score as 4.3 and a CVSS temporal score of 3.2.

Anyone know how XForce is getting these numbers? Not seeing similar numbers on NVD. CVSS Temporal scores seem like a promising lead for the research I'm doing but I'm not sure where the best source is for those.

CVE-2023-31122
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.76%

updated 2023-11-12T05:04:17

1 posts

Out-of-bounds Read vulnerability in mod_macro of Apache HTTP Server.This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: through 2.4.57.

vwbusguy@mastodon.online at 2024-04-01T16:57:59.000Z ##

@argv_minus_one In fairness, those disagreements are often warranted. Often things get a high score in NVD that would require the stars aligning in an incredibly unlikely way in a production environment with RHEL defaults.

CVE-2023-31122 is a good example of something NVD recently marked "High" where the conditions to exploit it require a very specific and uncommon setup.

CVE-2022-1271
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.52%

updated 2023-01-29T05:04:55

1 posts

An arbitrary file write vulnerability was found in GNU gzip's zgrep utility. When zgrep is applied on the attacker's chosen file name (for example, a crafted file name), this can overwrite an attacker's content to an arbitrary attacker-selected file. This flaw occurs due to insufficient validation when processing filenames with two or more newlines where selected content and the target file names

- CVE-2024-1403 CVSS 10.0 in Progress OpenEdge
- CVE-2023-40051 CVSS 9.9 in Progress OpenEdge
- CVE-2024-2389 CVSS 10.0 in Progress Flowmon
- CVE-2024-1800 CVSS 9.9 in Progress Telerik
- CVE-2023-42657 CVSS 9.9 in Progress WS_FTP
- CVE-2023-29375 CVSS 9.8 in Progress Sitefinity
- CVE-2023-2023 CVSS 9.8 in Progress DataDirect Connect for ODBC
- CVE-2023-35708 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit
- and the infamous CVE-2023-34362 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit.

There are other criticals too, but I figured 9.8 was a good cutoff to make the point that they belong in the same BINGO card as Ivanti, Fortinet, Cisco, and Exchange.

- CVE-2023-29375 CVSS 9.8 in Progress Sitefinity
- CVE-2023-2023 CVSS 9.8 in Progress DataDirect Connect for ODBC
- CVE-2023-35708 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit
- and the infamous CVE-2023-34362 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit.

There are other criticals too, but I figured 9.8 was a good cutoff to make the point that they belong in the same BINGO card as Ivanti, Fortinet, Cisco, and Exchange.

##

CVE-2022-48618
(7.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-02-29T17:46:18.173000

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.1, watchOS 9.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-03T18:26:36.000Z ##

@jgreig I've said this before about Apple quietly hiding an exploited zero-day vulnerability in a 2 year old security advisory, and the only reason we knew was from a government announcement, when CISA added CVE-2022-48618 to the KEV Catalog on 31 January 2024.

CVE-2024-23476
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.18%

updated 2024-02-15T21:31:35

1 posts

The SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability allows an unauthenticated user to achieve the Remote Code Execution.

##

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-04-03T06:15:07.873000

171 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked

##
bkrawczyk@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-03T11:56:58.000Z ##

@howtophil it has nothing to do with stable or unstable builds (builds of what exactly?). It was a stable release of xz. There are rolling-release distributions and packaging systems that would have just pulled it in. And that's exactly what happened.

And which system do you mean? Nobody maintaining the package for Debian, Fedora, Kali, openSUSE found it. It was a random guy from Microsoft that randomly discovered it - not the "system".

##
taylorparizo@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T00:23:11.000Z ##

This really was a well thought out supply chain attack. Jia Tan submitted a PR for OSS-Fuzz back in July 2023 to intentionally ignore the IFUNC feature which is used (maliciously) to perform runtime hooking/redirection of OpenSSH's authentication routines.
#cve20243094 https://www.reversinglabs.com/blog/a-software-supply-chain-meltdown-what-we-know-about-xz-trojan

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-04-02T16:46:20.393Z ##

One thing I haven't seen stated explicitly about #CVE_2024_3094: The engineer who found this is a Microsoft employee. Does that mean Microsoft runs the vulnerable configuration? Given that it isn't that common, could we reasonably deduce that Microsoft was a target?

Update: No; I'm just slow.

I misunderstood the nature of the systemd-ssh injection, which would have impacted any distro using systemd and sshd.

##
simontsui at 2024-04-02T15:59:01.282Z ##

Microsoft tech community has a Frequently Asked Questions and guidance for the XZ Utils backdoor (CVE-2024-3094). They provide guidance on using Microsoft products to assess exposure to CVE_2024-3094, e.g. Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management, and Defender for Cloud and advanced hunting queries.ð https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-defender-vulnerability/microsoft-faq-and-guidance-for-xz-utils-backdoor/ba-p/4101961

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack

##
simontsui at 2024-04-02T14:42:36.207Z ##

Akamai also has a resource guide for xz and CVE-2024-3094. Mitigation actions would be to downgrade to an uncompromised version, such as XZ Utils 5.4.6 Stable. Detection queries are provided. ð https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/critical-linux-backdoor-xz-utils-discovered-what-to-know

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack

##
simontsui at 2024-04-02T14:01:54.397Z ##

Regarding xz and CVE-2024-3094, Tenable has a list of affected Linux distributions updated 01 April 2024: ð https://www.tenable.com/blog/frequently-asked-questions-cve-2024-3094-supply-chain-backdoor-in-xz-utils

  • Fedora Rawhide
  • Fedora 40 Beta (All Fedora 40 beta users are encouraged to revert to 5.4.x versions of XZ.)
  • Fedora 41
  • Debian testing, unstable and experimental distributions versions 5.5.1alpha-0.1 to 5.6.1-1
  • openSUSE Tumbleweed and openSUSE MicroOS (between March 7 and March 28)
  • Kali Linux (between March 26 and March 28)
  • Arch Linux
    • installation medium 2024.03.01
    • virtual machine images 20240301.218094 and 20240315.221711
    • container images created between and including 2024-02-24 and 2024-03-28

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #Linux #supplychainattack

##
simontsui at 2024-04-01T18:05:46.800Z ##

Aqua includes their own security alert on CVE-2024-3094: Newly Discovered Backdoor in XZ tools. They also link the timeline provided by Evan Boehs. ð https://www.aquasec.com/blog/cve-2024-3094-newly-discovered-backdoor-in-xz-tools/

##
schmidt_fu@mstdn.social at 2024-04-04T05:00:31.000Z ##

reflections on distrusting xz

"Was the ssh backdoor the only goal that "Jia Tan" was pursuing with their multi-year operation against xz?

I doubt it, and if not, then every fix so far has been incomplete, because everything is still running code written by that entity."
https://joeyh.name/blog/entry/reflections_on_distrusting_xz/

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T19:49:51.000Z ##

The CEO of Phylum talks about the background of the XZ compromise and backdoor, and the challenges of open source software supply chain security. ð https://blog.phylum.io/xz-liblzma-backdoor-supply-chain-attack/

#cve_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack

##
mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-04-02T16:46:20.393Z ##

One thing I haven't seen stated explicitly about #CVE_2024_3094: The engineer who found this is a Microsoft employee. Does that mean Microsoft runs the vulnerable configuration? Given that it isn't that common, could we reasonably deduce that Microsoft was a target?

Update: No; I'm just slow.

I misunderstood the nature of the systemd-ssh injection, which would have impacted any distro using systemd and sshd.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T15:59:01.000Z ##

Microsoft tech community has a Frequently Asked Questions and guidance for the XZ Utils backdoor (CVE-2024-3094). They provide guidance on using Microsoft products to assess exposure to CVE_2024-3094, e.g. Microsoft Defender Vulnerability Management, and Defender for Cloud and advanced hunting queries.ð https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-defender-vulnerability/microsoft-faq-and-guidance-for-xz-utils-backdoor/ba-p/4101961

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T14:42:36.000Z ##

Akamai also has a resource guide for xz and CVE-2024-3094. Mitigation actions would be to downgrade to an uncompromised version, such as XZ Utils 5.4.6 Stable. Detection queries are provided. ð https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/critical-linux-backdoor-xz-utils-discovered-what-to-know

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T14:01:54.000Z ##

Regarding xz and CVE-2024-3094, Tenable has a list of affected Linux distributions updated 01 April 2024: ð https://www.tenable.com/blog/frequently-asked-questions-cve-2024-3094-supply-chain-backdoor-in-xz-utils

  • Fedora Rawhide
  • Fedora 40 Beta (All Fedora 40 beta users are encouraged to revert to 5.4.x versions of XZ.)
  • Fedora 41
  • Debian testing, unstable and experimental distributions versions 5.5.1alpha-0.1 to 5.6.1-1
  • openSUSE Tumbleweed and openSUSE MicroOS (between March 7 and March 28)
  • Kali Linux (between March 26 and March 28)
  • Arch Linux
    • installation medium 2024.03.01
    • virtual machine images 20240301.218094 and 20240315.221711
    • container images created between and including 2024-02-24 and 2024-03-28

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #Linux #supplychainattack

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T01:33:04.000Z ##

Zscaler security alert on CVE-2024-3094 was more comprehensive than I expected. They provide background information on xz, affected versions, technical details, and recommendations/detection: ð https://www.zscaler.com/blogs/security-research/cve-advisory-cve-2024-3094-security-compromise-xz-utils

#cve_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-01T21:51:37.000Z ##

bkrawczyk@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-03T11:58:23.000Z ##

@howtophil it is and should be a wake up call for open source community. It's all based on trust.

#xz #libzma #backdoor #security #cve #CVE20243094

##
bkrawczyk@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-03T11:56:58.000Z ##

@howtophil it has nothing to do with stable or unstable builds (builds of what exactly?). It was a stable release of xz. There are rolling-release distributions and packaging systems that would have just pulled it in. And that's exactly what happened.

And which system do you mean? Nobody maintaining the package for Debian, Fedora, Kali, openSUSE found it. It was a random guy from Microsoft that randomly discovered it - not the "system".
#xz #libzma #backdoor #security #cve #CVE20243094

##
taylorparizo@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T00:23:11.000Z ##

This really was a well thought out supply chain attack. Jia Tan submitted a PR for OSS-Fuzz back in July 2023 to intentionally ignore the IFUNC feature which is used (maliciously) to perform runtime hooking/redirection of OpenSSH's authentication routines.
#cve20243094 https://www.reversinglabs.com/blog/a-software-supply-chain-meltdown-what-we-know-about-xz-trojan

##

ã Without a doubt, the deliberate infiltration of backdoored upstream XZ tarballs into the Debian sid repository a few days ago, allowing remote SSH access without authentication, sparked a real storm in the Linux community ã

simontsui at 2024-04-02T14:01:54.397Z ##

Regarding xz and CVE-2024-3094, Tenable has a list of affected Linux distributions updated 01 April 2024: ð https://www.tenable.com/blog/frequently-asked-questions-cve-2024-3094-supply-chain-backdoor-in-xz-utils

  • Fedora Rawhide
  • Fedora 40 Beta (All Fedora 40 beta users are encouraged to revert to 5.4.x versions of XZ.)
  • Fedora 41
  • Debian testing, unstable and experimental distributions versions 5.5.1alpha-0.1 to 5.6.1-1
  • openSUSE Tumbleweed and openSUSE MicroOS (between March 7 and March 28)
  • Kali Linux (between March 26 and March 28)
  • Arch Linux
    • installation medium 2024.03.01
    • virtual machine images 20240301.218094 and 20240315.221711
    • container images created between and including 2024-02-24 and 2024-03-28

#Ubuntu #XZ #UnoLinux #sicurezza
Il rilascio della versione Beta di Ubuntu 24.04 LTS "Noble Numbat", inizialmente previsto per il prossimo 4 aprile, Ã¨ stato rimandato all'11 aprile 2024. La decisione di Canonical Ã¨ stata presa a causa della backdoor di XZ (vulnerabilitÃ  CVE-2024-3094) che da giorni sta causando diversi grattacapi ai manutentori delle principali distribuzioni Linux.

##
pentesttools@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T12:39:30.000Z ##

ð¨ The XZ Utils Backdoor (CVE-2024-3094) is a bitter reminder of how exposed the tech ecosystem is to supply-chain attacks. ð Security Researcher David Bors unpacks the *entire timeline* behind this critical SSH vulnerability and demonstrates how to achieve Remote Code Execution on the infected systems by passing the authentication in place (demo included).

https://pentest-tools.com/blog/xz-utils-backdoor-cve-2024-3094

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2024-04-02T11:01:58.000Z ##

If you use Microsoft Vulnerability Management, it is false positiving on CVE-2024-3094 aka #XZ backdoor - it is picking up the Cygwin version of XZ as vuln on Windows systems.

The Cygwin packages predate the backdoor and it doesnât impact Windows, also the file it flags isnât the backdoor but lzmadec.exe

https://cygwin.com/packages/summary/xz.html

##
ariadne@treehouse.systems at 2024-04-02T07:03:36.000Z ##

as I explain in my blog, the real problem is libraries which are large amalgamations of unrelated routines, such as libsystemd in the case of CVE-2024-3094.

a good solution is to split up these giant libraries into smaller ones, thus allowing for the dependency graphs of programs to remain leaner.

there is nothing about sd_notify() which requires LZMA compression. nothing. it is a function which writes a supplied string to a UNIX socket, the path of which is provided on an environmental variable.

##
hdm@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-01T16:37:39.000Z ##

Fantastic work by @amlw - xzbot

Exploration of the xz backdoor (CVE-2024-3094). Includes the following:

* honeypot: fake vulnerable server to detect exploit attempts

* ed448 patch: patch liblzma.so to use our own ED448 public key

* backdoor format: format of the backdoor payload

* backdoor demo: cli to trigger the RCE assuming knowledge of the ED448 private key

https://github.com/amlweems/xzbot

#xz #liblzma backdoor/exploit, CVE-2024-3094

Short update: the best source for up2date information on the history, analysis, fallout and moving forward is now https://gist.github.com/thesamesam/223949d5a074ebc3dce9ee78baad9e27

As expected, a lot of motivated but not well-informed or qualified people in the comments are adding fuel to a fire that is effectively under control and almost extinguished, so when you read that FAQ, please ignore most of the comments under it.

##
hdm@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-31T20:36:27.000Z ##

If you spent this weekend scrambling to respond to CVE-2024-3094 (the libxz-utils backdoor), we have good news! The universe of affected distributions seems small and relatively easy to track down: https://www.runzero.com/blog/how-to-find-systems-impacted-by-cve-2024-3094-libxz-utils-with-runzero/

TL;DR: The "rolling" releases affected by this issue all use very new builds of OpenSSH (9.6p1/9.7p1) which simplifies the search.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-31T03:53:26.000Z ##

Unit 42 (waiting about 38 hours after the news broke) gives a threat brief on CVE-2024-3094, which is the result of a supply chain compromise impacting the versions 5.6.0 and 5.6.1 of XZ Utils. XZ Utils is data compression software included in major Linux distributions. To be fair, Unit 42's list of affected distros and versions is more comprehensive than the other companies. ð https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/threat-brief-xz-utils-cve-2024-3094/

#CVE_2024_3094 #xz #supplychainattack #liblzma

harrysintonen@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-30T21:10:39.000Z ##

Preliminary results from #liblzma SSH #backdoor CVE-2024-3094 reversing:
"The hooked RSA_public_decrypt verifies a signature on the server's host key by a fixed Ed448 key, and then passes a payload to system(). It's RCE, not auth bypass, and gated/unreplayable." https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/30/36 #infosec #cybersecurity #CVE20243094

##
devuan@toot.community at 2024-03-30T16:55:42.000Z ##

Devuan is not affected by the latest vulnerability caused by systemd. The malicious backdoor in xz/liblzma is a vector for remote exploitation of the ssh daemon due to a dependency on systemd for notifications and due to systemd's call to dlopen() liblzma library (CVE-2024-3094)

##
jwildeboer@social.wildeboer.net at 2024-03-30T13:35:16.000Z ##

This #xz backdoor is tracked as CVE-2024-3094 and this CVE was opened by #RedHat. You can find our data on this at https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-3094 If you search for "CVE-2024-3094" with the search engine of your choice you will find a growing list of references (and clickbait stories) of which https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-3094 is a bit more relevant as it contains a long list of links to more news and background. The thread that started it all is at https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

The FAQ is at https://gist.github.com/thesamesam/223949d5a074ebc3dce9ee78baad9e27

KO6YQ@pnw.zone at 2024-03-30T03:02:58.000Z ##

"xz Backdoor CVE-2024-3094" by @openssf - XZ 5.6.0 and 5.6.1 are vulnerable/backdoored. No #Linux distributions had released it yet. Users who built it should urgently revert to 5.4.x. https://openssf.org/blog/2024/03/30/xz-backdoor-cve-2024-3094/ #cybersecurity #OpenSource #software #tech

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-30T01:27:37.000Z ##

CISA is aware of a supply chain compromise affecting XZ Utils Data Compression Library, which is being tracked as CVE-2024-3094 (10.0 critical CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H; CWE-506: Embedded Malicious Code). CISA describes XZ Utils as data compression software. ð https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/03/29/reported-supply-chain-compromise-affecting-xz-utils-data-compression-library-cve-2024-3094

Red Hat in their security alert states verbatim: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/urgent-security-alert-fedora-41-and-rawhide-users

...the latest versions of the âxzâ tools and libraries contain malicious code that appears to be intended to allow unauthorized access. Specifically, this code is present in versions 5.6.0 and 5.6.1 of the libraries.
PLEASE IMMEDIATELY STOP USAGE OF ANY FEDORA RAWHIDE INSTANCES for work or personal activity.

Bugzilla 2272210 provides even more information: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272210

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0.
Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked against this library, intercepting and modifying the data interaction with this library.

#CVE_2024_3094 #backdoor #fedora #xz

##
eckes@zusammenkunft.net at 2024-03-30T01:13:13.000Z ##

Of course CVE-2024-3094 (xz-util/liblzma5 backdoor) must happen at the holidays #xz

##
eriner@noauthority.social at 2024-03-30T00:33:27.000Z ##

@John The post you're commenting on is a bit in the weeds. At a high level, the xz compression library was intentionally subverted by one of the project maintainers and a backdoor was inserted. This impacted SSH on Debian and Fedora, two very popular linux distros.

The best high-level writeup I can find is Michael Larabel's: https://www.phoronix.com/news/XZ-CVE-2024-3094

##
vwbusguy@mastodon.online at 2024-03-29T23:23:04.000Z ##

If you're running #Fedora 40 Beta or Rawhide or #Debian Sid or some other rolling #Linux distro, an ssh backdoor was found in xz and you need to downgrade immediately.

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2024-3094

:fedora: RedHat and :geeko: Suse seem to be more precise with their communication. (And Ubuntu hasn't published anything by now, as far as I can tell.)

##
Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-03-29T19:56:57.000Z ##

#linux #security #xz #cve20243094

Someone put a backdoor in the xz library.

Because of the CVE-2024-3094 in xz, I Downgraded my system packages to:

~ â¯ sudo dnf downgrade xz
xz-5.4.6-1.fc40.x86_6
xz-devel-5.4.6-1.fc40.x86_64
xz-libs-5.4.6-1.fc40.i686
xz-libs-5.4.6-1.fc40.x86_64
xz-lzma-compat-5.4.6-1.fc40.x86_64

Another solution on #Fedora40 would be "sudo dnf upgrade --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2024-d02c7bb266" but the mirror, I use doesn't seem to have that advisory yet.

https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/urgent-security-alert-fedora-41-and-rawhide-users
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-d02c7bb266
https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-3094

##
tinker@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-29T19:33:00.000Z ##

Well this is fucking lovely....

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of "xz" which then affects liblzma

Downstream there may be backdoors in various implementations of "sshd".

Versions Affected:

  • Fedora 41
  • Fedora Rawhide
  • openSUSE Tumbleweed
  • Debian testing, unstable, experimental distributions
  • Kali updates between March 26th and March 29th

Original notice here:
https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

Red Hat CVE: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-3094

Red Hat Security Blog Post: https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/urgent-security-alert-fedora-41-and-rawhide-users

Arch Linux Security Post: https://archlinux.org/news/the-xz-package-has-been-backdoored/

Debian Security Post: https://lists.debian.org/debian-security-announce/2024/msg00057.html

openSUSE Security Post: https://news.opensuse.org/2024/03/29/xz-backdoor/

Kali Linux announcement: https://infosec.exchange/@kalilinux/112180505434870941

CISA Advisory: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/03/29/reported-supply-chain-compromise-affecting-xz-utils-data-compression-library-cve-2024-3094

Article here: https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/03/29/cve-2024-3094-linux-backdoor/

#infosec #linux #foss #hacking #cve20243094 #cve

##
tuxwise@social.tchncs.de at 2024-03-29T19:24:25.000Z ##

Please research what your #Linux #distro has recommended to mitigate CVE-2024-3094, and implement it.

This is not a premature April Fools' Day joke, take it seriously.

#cve20243094 #SupplyChainAttack

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-29T19:23:00.000Z ##

For those wondering, this toot is in reference to the supply chain compromise in xz utils. This is #upstream to (and used by) many Linux distros.

Because of some distributions patching openssh to support systemd notification, this could lead to sshd compromise... the backdoor seems to set the stage for total system compromise. Or at least the ability to remotely execute code on the system.

Good news? Most end users of #Linux distros stable channels should not be affected.

Looks like it primarily affects rolling channels... specifically affected distros include Fedora Rawhide, Fedora 41, and Debian unstable/beta/testing. Seems like the #security teams of both have reverted to versions that do not contain the malicious code.

Tracked as CVE-2024-3094 with 10/10 severity.

#cve #cybersecurity #opensource

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/red-hat-warns-of-backdoor-in-xz-tools-used-by-most-linux-distros/

##
richlv@mastodon.social at 2024-03-29T19:18:36.000Z ##

ArÄ« OpenSUSE Tumbleweed un citiem var bÅ«t interesanti - te no manas Tumbleweed instalÄcijas...
Par laimi, tajÄ instancÄ sshd vispÄr nedarbojas.

> rpm -qa 'liblzma*'
liblzma5-5.6.1-1.1.x86_64

Kontekstam: CVE-2024-3094 .

##
sethmlarson@fosstodon.org at 2024-03-29T19:03:10.000Z ##

xz/liblzma backdoor (CVE-2024-3094) is trending.

https://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

#Python bundles xz v5.2.5 and earlier which don't contain the backdoored binary files. #PyPI is also not affected due to using Debian Bookworm, not Sid.

Querying PyPI packages and Python Dockerhub images doesn't show any xz 5.6.x binaries.

From what I've gathered from others, the backdoor appears to target sshd (SSH server) on glibc-based distros, so if you're using Ubuntu or Fedora check that you aren't affected.

##
eriner@noauthority.social at 2024-03-29T19:02:28.000Z ##

Oooooooof

> Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. The tarballs included extra .m4 files, which contained instructions for building with automake that did not exist in the repository.

https://security.archlinux.org/CVE-2024-3094

alienghic@octodon.social at 2024-03-29T18:23:01.000Z ##

If you're on Debian testing/sid you want to make sure you don't have xz-utils 5.6.0 or 5.6.1 installed.

You should either have an earlier 5.4 version or 5.6.1+really5.4.5-1

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-29T17:03:35.000Z ##

CVE-2024-3094 is a back door with seemingly active exploitation:

A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in code-projects Agro-School Management System 1.0. Affected is the function doUpdateQuestion of the file btn_functions.php. The manipulation of the argument question_id leads to sql injection. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. VDB-230670 is the identifier assigned to this vulnerability.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

#CVE_2024_3094 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2024-03-29T16:57:42.000Z ##

Some good sleuthing and interesting chaining here:

CVE-2024-3094: backdoor in upstream xz/liblzma leading to ssh server compromise

inserted m4 code -> configure script -> injected code into xz -> sshd when compiled with liblzma (e.g., used by systemd, what else)

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

##
christian@suma-ev.social at 2024-03-29T16:30:20.000Z ##

Popular compression tool #xzutils containing #malware seems like a biggie. I am unable to find a website with details, so I am quoting from the e-mail that was sent to debian-security-announce@lists.debian.org:

Package: xz-utils
CVE ID: CVE-2024-3094

Andres Freund discovered that the upstream source tarballs for xz-utils, the XZ-format compression utilities, are compromised and inject malicious code, at build time, into the resulting liblzma5 library.

#SupplyChainAttack #CVE_2024_3094

##
delroth@delroth.net at 2024-03-29T16:26:32.000Z ##

xz-utils was backdoored by its upstream. Tracked as CVE-2024-3094 and thoroughly documented by vuln discoverer Andres Freund on oss-security@: https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2024/03/29/4

##

CVE-2024-31138
(4.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-03-28T16:07:30.893000

3 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 xSS was possible via Agent Distribution settings

simontsui at 2024-04-01T19:00:56.515Z ##

Zero Day Initiative security advisory reveals additional information on CVE-2024-31138 (4.6 medium, CVSSv3.1:AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N) ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-360/

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary script on affected installations of JetBrains TeamCity. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

The specific flaw exists within the handling of the os parameter provided to the AgentDistributionSettingsController.doPost method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can lead to the injection of arbitrary script. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute script in the context of the current user.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_31138

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-01T19:00:56.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative security advisory reveals additional information on CVE-2024-31138 (4.6 medium, CVSSv3.1:AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N) ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-360/

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary script on affected installations of JetBrains TeamCity. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

The specific flaw exists within the handling of the os parameter provided to the AgentDistributionSettingsController.doPost method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can lead to the injection of arbitrary script. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute script in the context of the current user.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_31138

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-28T20:05:07.000Z ##

JetBrains Security Bulletin only shows 7 vulnerabilities out of "26 security problems fixed": ð https://www.jetbrains.com/privacy-security/issues-fixed/?product=TeamCity&version=2024.03

  • CVE-2024-31134 (vendor 6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 authenticated users without administrative permissions could register other users when self-registration was disabled
  • CVE-2024-31135 (vendor 6.1 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 open redirect was possible on the login page
  • CVE-2024-31136 (vendor 7.4 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 2FA could be bypassed by providing a special URL parameter
  • CVE-2024-31137 (vendor 6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 reflected XSS was possible via Space connection configuration
  • CVE-2024-31138 (vendor 4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 xSS was possible via Agent Distribution settings
  • CVE-2024-31139 (vendor 5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 xXE was possible in the Maven build steps detector
  • CVE-2024-31140 (vendor 4.1 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 server administrators could remove arbitrary files from the server by installing tools

cc: @campuscodi

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability

CVE-2023-29389
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2023-04-22T05:07:54

2 posts

Toyota RAV4 2021 vehicles automatically trust messages from other ECUs on a CAN bus, which allows physically proximate attackers to drive a vehicle by accessing the control CAN bus after pulling the bumper away and reaching the headlight connector, and then sending forged "Key is validated" messages via CAN Injection, as exploited in the wild in (for example) July 2022.

kentindell@mastodon.social at 2024-04-05T11:08:12.000Z ##

Toyota have responded to CVE-2023-29389 (the CAN Injection Attack from reverse engineering by @mintynet and me after Ianâs RAV4 was stolen). It was issued the same day as a BBC Watchdog investigation into high-tech car theft was aired (I appeared on the programme to discuss it).

https://mag.toyota.co.uk/toyota-gb-statement-on-vehicle-theft/

##

##

CVE-2024-30370
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-04-02T21:30:37

4 posts

RARLAB WinRAR Mark-Of-The-Web Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-Of-The-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must perform a specific action on a malicious page. The specific flaw exists within the archive extraction functionality. A crafted

simontsui at 2024-04-01T19:12:51.656Z ##

Another Zero Day Initiative security advisory, since RARLAB failed to include the CVE ID in their release notes: CVE-2024-30370 (4.3 medium, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N) RARLAB WinRAR Mark-Of-The-Web Bypass Vulnerability. I'm not a betting man, but I can see threat actors utilizing this quickly based on historical abuse. ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-357/ and https://www.rarlab.com/rarnew.htm#27.%20Busgs%20fixed

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-Of-The-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must perform a specific action on a malicious page.

The specific flaw exists within the archive extraction functionality. A crafted archive entry can cause the creation of an arbitrary file without the Mark-Of-The-Web. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

#CVE_2024_30370 #markoftheweb #WinRAR #vulnerability

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-01T19:12:51.000Z ##

Another Zero Day Initiative security advisory, since RARLAB failed to include the CVE ID in their release notes: CVE-2024-30370 (4.3 medium, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N) RARLAB WinRAR Mark-Of-The-Web Bypass Vulnerability. I'm not a betting man, but I can see threat actors utilizing this quickly based on historical abuse. ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-357/ and https://www.rarlab.com/rarnew.htm#27.%20Busgs%20fixed

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-Of-The-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must perform a specific action on a malicious page.

The specific flaw exists within the archive extraction functionality. A crafted archive entry can cause the creation of an arbitrary file without the Mark-Of-The-Web. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

#CVE_2024_30370 #markoftheweb #WinRAR #vulnerability

##
simontsui at 2024-04-01T19:12:51.656Z ##

Another Zero Day Initiative security advisory, since RARLAB failed to include the CVE ID in their release notes: CVE-2024-30370 (4.3 medium, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N) RARLAB WinRAR Mark-Of-The-Web Bypass Vulnerability. I'm not a betting man, but I can see threat actors utilizing this quickly based on historical abuse. ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-357/ and https://www.rarlab.com/rarnew.htm#27.%20Busgs%20fixed

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-Of-The-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must perform a specific action on a malicious page.

The specific flaw exists within the archive extraction functionality. A crafted archive entry can cause the creation of an arbitrary file without the Mark-Of-The-Web. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

updated 2023-09-29T14:34:24.630000

In WS_FTP Server versions prior to 8.7.4 and 8.8.2, a directory traversal vulnerability was discovered.Â  An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to perform file operations (delete, rename, rmdir, mkdir) on files and folders outside of their authorized WS_FTP folder path.Â  Attackers could also escape the context of the WS_FTP Server file structure and perform the same level of operations (

##

CVE-2024-28085
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-28T02:01:21.693000

12 posts

wall in util-linux through 2.40, often installed with setgid tty permissions, allows escape sequences to be sent to other users' terminals through argv. (Specifically, escape sequences received from stdin are blocked, but escape sequences received from argv are not blocked.) There may be plausible scenarios where this leads to account takeover.

1 repos

https://github.com/skyler-ferrante/CVE-2024-28085

theruran@hackers.town at 2024-04-02T15:56:28.000Z ##

The security defect, tracked as CVE-2024-28085 and dubbed âWallEscapeâ, impacts the âwallâ command of util-linux that fails to filter escape sequences from command line arguments.

An attacker could embed escape sequences into crafted messages and send them via the âwallâ command, allowing them to leak passwords and modify commands, if specific conditions are met.

https://www.securityweek.com/wallescape-linux-vulnerability-leaks-user-passwords/

Does anybody still use wall?..

#infosec #WallEscape #CVE202428085

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-01T17:10:03.000Z ##

theruran@hackers.town at 2024-04-02T15:56:28.000Z ##

The security defect, tracked as CVE-2024-28085 and dubbed âWallEscapeâ, impacts the âwallâ command of util-linux that fails to filter escape sequences from command line arguments.

An attacker could embed escape sequences into crafted messages and send them via the âwallâ command, allowing them to leak passwords and modify commands, if specific conditions are met.

https://www.securityweek.com/wallescape-linux-vulnerability-leaks-user-passwords/

Does anybody still use wall?..

#infosec #WallEscape #CVE202428085

##
cdarwin@c.im at 2024-03-30T20:34:16.000Z ##

CVE-2024-28085 essentially exploits improperly filtered escape sequences provided via command line arguments to trick users into creating a fake sudo (aka superuser do) prompt on other users' terminals and trick them into entering their passwords.

However, for this to work, the mesg utility â which controls the ability to display messages from other users â has to be set to "y" (i.e., enabled) and the wall command has to have setgid permissions.

CVE-2024-28085 impacts Ubuntu 22.04 and Debian Bookworm as these two criteria are met. On the other hand, CentOS is not vulnerable since the wall command does not have setgid.

Users are advised to update to util-linux version 2.40 to mitigate against the flaw.
https://thehackernews.com/2024/03/new-linux-bug-could-lead-to-user.html?m=1

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2024-03-29T21:21:04.000Z ##

Decade-old #Linux âwallâ bug helps make fake #SUDO prompts, steal #passwords
Tracked as CVE-2024-28085, the security issue has been dubbed #WallEscape and has been present in every version of the package for the past 11 years up to 2.40 released yesterday. Users on shared systems could #exploit the #vulnerability using escape control characters to create a fake SUDO prompt on other users' terminals and trick them into typing their administrator password.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/decade-old-linux-wall-bug-helps-make-fake-sudo-prompts-steal-passwords/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-29T12:51:20.000Z ##

The bug, tracked as CVE-2024-28085, has been codenamed WallEscape by security researcher Skyler Ferrante. It has been described as a case of improper neutralization of escape sequences. https://thehackernews.com/2024/03/new-linux-bug-could-lead-to-user.html

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-03-28T00:32:33.000Z ##

Security researcher Skyler Ferrante has discovered a vulnerability in Wall, a Linux utility to display a message on the terminals of all logged-in users.

The vulnerability allows unprivileged users to put arbitrary text on other users' terminals.

Ferrrante says all Wall versions released over the past 11 years are vulnerable. He named the vulnerability WallEscape (CVE-2024-28085).

https://people.rit.edu/sjf5462/6831711781/wall_2_27_2024.txt

CVE-2023-45288
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T23:02:58

3 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.654Z ##

CERT/CC security advisory: HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames can be utilized for DoS attacks ð https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T12:46:01.000Z ##

The Go team is expecting to release Go 1.22.2 and Go 1.21.9 during US business hours on Wednesday, April 3. This is to release a security fix for a privately disclosed vulnerability labeled as CVE-2023-45288 There isn't more data about the vuln at this time.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/nUtcDA04HLM

It looks like this has been in the works for a bit since the CVE is from 2023 and an issue was opened in their public GH repo on Jan 10. It looked like they originally planned to backport it to 1.20 but missed the window.

https://github.com/golang/go/issues/65051

#Security #Go #Golang

kernellogger@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-02T09:37:18.000Z ##

In case anyone wonders if the #Linux CVE team releases #LinuxKernel CVEs before the problem is fixed in stable and longterm series:

Yes, they sometimes do this when the fix hit the mainline #kernel; not that often from a quick look, but yesterday I noticed two such cases by chance:

https://lore.kernel.org/all/2024040122-CVE-2024-26653-7903@gregkh/

updated 2024-03-29T06:30:30

2 posts

Use after free in WebCodecs in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.86 allowed a remote attacker to perform arbitrary read/write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T21:36:58.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published 4 Chromium security advisories (none exploited) that don't contain any additional information beyond what was already disclosed in Google Chrome's blog post:

  • CVE-2024-2883 (critical severity) Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-2885 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-2886 (high severity) Use after free in WebCodecs
  • CVE-2024-2887 (high severity) Type Confusion in WebAssembly

#Microsoft #MSRC #Chrome #PatchTuesday

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T18:23:41.000Z ##

@avoidthehack Two of the vulnerabilities were demonstrated at Pwn2Own Vancouver 2024: Use After Free CVE-2024-2886 (high severity) by KAIST Hacking Lab on day 1, and Type Confusion CVE-2024-2887 (high severity) Manfred Paul of Zero Day Initiative on day 2.

EPSS: 0.04%

1 posts

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T21:36:58.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published 4 Chromium security advisories (none exploited) that don't contain any additional information beyond what was already disclosed in Google Chrome's blog post:

  • CVE-2024-2883 (critical severity) Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-2885 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-2886 (high severity) Use after free in WebCodecs
  • CVE-2024-2887 (high severity) Type Confusion in WebAssembly

#Microsoft #MSRC #Chrome #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2024-2883(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-29T06:30:30

1 posts

Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.86 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Critical)

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-27T21:36:58.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published 4 Chromium security advisories (none exploited) that don't contain any additional information beyond what was already disclosed in Google Chrome's blog post:

  • CVE-2024-2883 (critical severity) Use after free in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-2885 (high severity) Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-2886 (high severity) Use after free in WebCodecs
  • CVE-2024-2887 (high severity) Type Confusion in WebAssembly

1 posts

CVE-2023-50969
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-29T12:45:02.937000

2 posts

Thales Imperva SecureSphere WAF 14.7.0.40 allows remote attackers to bypass WAF rules via a crafted POST request, a different vulnerability than CVE-2021-45468.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-02T07:15:02.000Z ##

Imperva WAF Flaw (CVE-2023-50969) Exposes Organizations to Breaches https://thecyberexpress.com/cve-2023-50969-vulnerability/ #ImpervaSecureSphereVulnerability #CVE202350969Vulnerability #WebApplicationFirewalls #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202350969

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-04-02T15:23:48.000Z ##

A security researcher has discovered a vulnerability (CVE-2023-50969) in Imperva SecureSphere firewalls.

The vulnerability allows attackers to manipulate HTTP headers and slip malicious payloads past the firewall.

Approximately 400 Imperva SecureSphere firewalls are currently exposed online. Imperva released a fix at the end of February.

https://www.hoyahaxa.com/2024/03/imperva-waf-bypass-cve-2023-50969.html

(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-03T18:30:42

3 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business RV016, RV042, RV042G, RV082, RV320, and RV325 Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. This vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation by the web-based management interface. An attacker could exploit this vulnerabi

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-03T16:33:03.000Z ##

Cisco prefers "Patch Wednesday" because they dropped 12 security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20347, CVE-2024-20352 (4.9 medium) Cisco Emergency Responder Cross-Site Request Forgery and Directory Traversal Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20334 (5.5 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20362 (6.1 medium) Cisco Small Business RV016, RV042, RV042G, RV082, RV320, and RV325 Routers Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20282 (6.0 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20302 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator Unauthorized Policy Actions Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20283 (4.3 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20281 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability (note: Cisco marked this as medium severity)
  • CVE-2024-20348 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Plug and Play Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20332 (5.5 medium) Cisco Identity Services Engine Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20368 (6.5 medium) Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20367 (5.4 medium) Cisco Enterprise Chat and Email Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20310 (6.1 medium) Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

Wireshark security advisory: CVE-2024-2955 (7.8 high, disclosed 26 March 2024) Denial of Service fixed in Wireshark 4.2.4 or later. Wireshark disputes/rejects CVE-2024-24478, CVE-2024-24479, and CVE-2024-24476 which are based on invalid assumptions and were not coordinated with Wireshark project. 10 other issues fixed without being assigned CVE IDs. ð https://www.wireshark.org/docs/relnotes/wireshark-4.2.4.html

12 posts

A heap overflow vulnerability in IPSec component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated malicious user to send specially crafted requests in-order-to crash the service thereby causing a DoS attack. In certain conditions this may lead to execution of arbitrary code

##
simontsui at 2024-04-03T16:39:30.394Z ##

I want to get off Mr. Ivanti's wild ride: security advisory for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure: ð https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways and blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure

  • CVE-2024-21894 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to Denial of Service (DoS), and sometimes arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-22052 (7.5 high) null pointer dereference causes DoS
  • CVE-2024-22053 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to DoS or information disclosure
  • CVE-2024-22023 (5.3 medium) XML entity expansion (XEE) causes a limited-time DoS

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by these vulnerabilities at the time of disclosure.

4 new CVEs, 2 high severity for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Gateways:

CVE-2024-21894 and CVE-2024-22053 are heap overflows, in certain conditions allow remote code execution
(CVE-2024-21894) or reading of contents in memory (CVE-2024-22053)

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-03T21:12:30.000Z ##

Here goes #Ivanti #connectsecure again

4 new CVEs, 2 high severity for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Gateways:

CVE-2024-21894 and CVE-2024-22053 are heap overflows, in certain conditions allow remote code execution
(CVE-2024-21894) or reading of contents in memory (CVE-2024-22053)

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##

CVE-2024-22052
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T21:30:30

10 posts

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in IPSec component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated malicious user to send specially crafted requests in-order-to crash the service thereby causing a DoS attack

simontsui at 2024-04-03T16:39:30.394Z ##

I want to get off Mr. Ivanti's wild ride: security advisory for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure: ð https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways and blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure

  • CVE-2024-21894 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to Denial of Service (DoS), and sometimes arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-22052 (7.5 high) null pointer dereference causes DoS
  • CVE-2024-22053 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to DoS or information disclosure
  • CVE-2024-22023 (5.3 medium) XML entity expansion (XEE) causes a limited-time DoS

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by these vulnerabilities at the time of disclosure.

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #PolicySecure #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21894 #CVE_2024_22052 #CVE_2024_22053 #CVE_2024_22023

##

CVE-2024-22053
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T21:30:31

10 posts

A heap overflow vulnerability in IPSec component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated malicious user to send specially crafted requests in-order-to crash the service thereby causing a DoS attack or in certain conditions read contents from memory.

simontsui at 2024-04-03T16:39:30.394Z ##

I want to get off Mr. Ivanti's wild ride: security advisory for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure: ð https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways and blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure

  • CVE-2024-21894 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to Denial of Service (DoS), and sometimes arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-22052 (7.5 high) null pointer dereference causes DoS
  • CVE-2024-22053 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to DoS or information disclosure
  • CVE-2024-22023 (5.3 medium) XML entity expansion (XEE) causes a limited-time DoS

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by these vulnerabilities at the time of disclosure.

Here goes #Ivanti #connectsecure again

4 new CVEs, 2 high severity for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure Gateways:

CVE-2024-21894 and CVE-2024-22053 are heap overflows, in certain conditions allow remote code execution
(CVE-2024-21894) or reading of contents in memory (CVE-2024-22053)

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways?language=en_US

##

CVE-2024-22023
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T21:30:30

10 posts

An XML entity expansion or XEE vulnerability in SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated attacker to send specially crafted XML requests in-order-to temporarily cause resource exhaustion thereby resulting in a limited-time DoS.

simontsui at 2024-04-03T16:39:30.394Z ##

I want to get off Mr. Ivanti's wild ride: security advisory for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure: ð https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways and blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure

  • CVE-2024-21894 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to Denial of Service (DoS), and sometimes arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-22052 (7.5 high) null pointer dereference causes DoS
  • CVE-2024-22053 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to DoS or information disclosure
  • CVE-2024-22023 (5.3 medium) XML entity expansion (XEE) causes a limited-time DoS

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by these vulnerabilities at the time of disclosure.

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #PolicySecure #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21894 #CVE_2024_22052 #CVE_2024_22053 #CVE_2024_22023

cR0w at 2024-04-04T16:19:01.738Z ##

@simontsui As far as anything 9.8 or higher in the past year or so, there are also:

- CVE-2024-1403 CVSS 10.0 in Progress OpenEdge
- CVE-2023-40051 CVSS 9.9 in Progress OpenEdge
- CVE-2024-2389 CVSS 10.0 in Progress Flowmon
- CVE-2024-1800 CVSS 9.9 in Progress Telerik
- CVE-2023-42657 CVSS 9.9 in Progress WS_FTP
- CVE-2023-29375 CVSS 9.8 in Progress Sitefinity
- CVE-2023-2023 CVSS 9.8 in Progress DataDirect Connect for ODBC
- CVE-2023-35708 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit
- and the infamous CVE-2023-34362 CVSS 9.8 in Progress MOVEit.

There are other criticals too, but I figured 9.8 was a good cutoff to make the point that they belong in the same BINGO card as Ivanti, Fortinet, Cisco, and Exchange.

No mention of exploitation in the wild. ð https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/23215

CVE-2024-29049
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-05T12:40:52.763000

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Webview2 Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-04-05T00:37:51.574Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published security advisories that follow the Google Chrome blog post (check original toot above this reply)

  • CVE-2024-3156 Chromium: CVE-2024-3156 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-3158 Chromium: CVE-2024-3158 Use after free in Bookmarks
  • CVE-2024-3159 Chromium: CVE-2024-3159 Out of bounds memory access in V8 New
  • CVE-2024-29981 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability New!
  • CVE-2024-29049 (4.1 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Webview2 Spoofing Vulnerability New!

The last two are marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

CVE-2024-31080
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T16:33:06.610000

1 posts

A heap-based buffer over-read vulnerability was found in the X.org server's ProcXIGetSelectedEvents() function. This issue occurs when byte-swapped length values are used in replies, potentially leading to memory leakage and segmentation faults, particularly when triggered by a client with a different endianness. This vulnerability could be exploited by an attacker to cause the X server to read he

secbsd@exquisite.social at 2024-04-04T22:23:40.000Z ##

Upgrade to the latest SecBSD 1.5 snapshot!, which addresses CVE-2024-31080, CVE-2024-31081, and CVE-2024-31083. Keep your systems safe and secure.

Download:
https://mirror.secbsd.org/pub/SecBSD/snapshots/amd64/
https://mirror.laylo.nl/pub/SecBSD/snapshots/amd64/

#SecBSD #OpenBSD #OpenSource #CyberSecurity #Infosec

##

CVE-2024-31081
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T16:33:06.610000

1 posts

A heap-based buffer over-read vulnerability was found in the X.org server's ProcXIPassiveGrabDevice() function. This issue occurs when byte-swapped length values are used in replies, potentially leading to memory leakage and segmentation faults, particularly when triggered by a client with a different endianness. This vulnerability could be exploited by an attacker to cause the X server to read he

secbsd@exquisite.social at 2024-04-04T22:23:40.000Z ##

Progress security advisory: CVE-2024-1800 (9.9 critical, disclosed 20 March 2024) Insecure Deserialization Vulnerability in Telerik Report Server versions prior to 2024 Q1 (10.0.24.130) allows for remote code execution. ð https://docs.telerik.com/report-server/knowledge-base/deserialization-vulnerability-cve-2024-1800

Why you should care about CVE-2024-1800: CISA released a cybersecurity advisory on 15 June 2023 warning of threat actors exploiting Progress Telerik vulnerabilities in multiple U.S. Government IIS Servers.

Currently no advisory (published or pending) from Zero Day Initiative, who reported the vulnerability.

Moby is an open source container framework that is a key component of Docker Engine, Docker Desktop, and other distributions of container tooling or runtimes. This feature is frequently referred to as custom networks, as each network can have a different driver, set of parame

netzwerkgoettin@konfigurationsmanufaktur.de at 2024-04-04T14:55:03.000Z ##

Das vermutlich.

"CVE-2024-29018: Do not forward requests to external DNS servers for a container that is only connected to an 'internal' network."

Update: das scheint dann auch auf Container zuzutreffen, die mit einem Bein in einem externen und mit dem anderen Bein in einem internen Netz stehen.

Envoy is a cloud-native, open source edge and service proxy. The HTTP/2 protocol stack in Envoy versions prior to 1.29.3, 1.28.2, 1.27.4, and 1.26.8 are vulnerable to CPU exhaustion due to flood of CONTINUATION frames. Envoy's HTTP/2 codec allows the client to send an unlimited number of CONTINUATION frames even after exceeding Envoy's header map limits. This allows an attacker to send a sequence

CVE-2024-27316
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-05T12:40:52.763000

2 posts

HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

##

CVE-2024-27919
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T16:33:06.610000

2 posts

Envoy is a cloud-native, open-source edge and service proxy. In versions 1.29.0 and 1.29.1, theEnvoy HTTP/2 protocol stack is vulnerable to the flood of CONTINUATION frames. Envoy's HTTP/2 codec does not reset a request when header map limits have been exceeded. This allows an attacker to send an sequence of CONTINUATION frames without the END_HEADERS bit set causing unlimited memory consumption.

simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.654Z ##

CERT/CC security advisory: HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames can be utilized for DoS attacks ð https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS

##

CVE-2024-2653
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-03T18:54:55

2 posts

`amphp/http` will collect HTTP/2 `CONTINUATION` frames in an unbounded buffer and will not check the header size limit until it has received the `END_HEADERS` flag, resulting in an OOM crash. `amphp/http-client` and `amphp/http-server` are indirectly affected if they're used with an unpatched version of `amphp/http`. Early versions of `amphp/http-client` with HTTP/2 support (v4.0.0-rc10 to 4.0.0)

2 repos

https://github.com/sajaljat/CVE-2024-26534

https://github.com/sajaljat/CVE-2024-26535

Cisco prefers "Patch Wednesday" because they dropped 12 security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-20347, CVE-2024-20352 (4.9 medium) Cisco Emergency Responder Cross-Site Request Forgery and Directory Traversal Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20334 (5.5 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20362 (6.1 medium) Cisco Small Business RV016, RV042, RV042G, RV082, RV320, and RV325 Routers Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20282 (6.0 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20302 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator Unauthorized Policy Actions Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20283 (4.3 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20281 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability (note: Cisco marked this as medium severity)
  • CVE-2024-20348 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Plug and Play Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20332 (5.5 medium) Cisco Identity Services Engine Server-Side Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20368 (6.5 medium) Cisco Identity Services Engine Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20367 (5.4 medium) Cisco Enterprise Chat and Email Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20310 (6.1 medium) Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

  • CVE-2024-20347, CVE-2024-20352 (4.9 medium) Cisco Emergency Responder Cross-Site Request Forgery and Directory Traversal Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20334 (5.5 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20362 (6.1 medium) Cisco Small Business RV016, RV042, RV042G, RV082, RV320, and RV325 Routers Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20282 (6.0 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20302 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator Unauthorized Policy Actions Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20283 (4.3 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20281 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard and Nexus Dashboard Hosted Services Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability (note: Cisco marked this as medium severity)
  • CVE-2024-20348 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Plug and Play Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

  • CVE-2024-31392 security feature bypass (show page with mixed content as "secure" if insecure element added to page after a delay)

CVE-2024-2879
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-03T06:30:54

1 posts

The LayerSlider plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the ls_get_popup_markup action in versions 7.9.11 and 7.10.0 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract

1 repos

https://github.com/JohnNetSouldRU/CVE-2024-2879-POC

The flaw, designated as CVE-2024-2879, carries a CVSS score of 9.8 out of a maximum of 10.0. It has been described as a case of SQL injection impacting versions from 7.9.11 through 7.10.0. https://thehackernews.com/2024/04/critical-security-flaw-found-in-popular.html
